   { 'en-US':
      '##########################################\nMore Flash demo can be viewed here\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/b17467149b371a5c5ffef2538d19ed3e877e4e9fb2038575e44ad08e370e77ce/http%3A//inforss.mozdev.org/demo.html">http://inforss.mozdev.org/demo.html</a>\n##########################################\n\nDisplays RSS, Atom, Twitter, parsed HTML and NNTP feed in a scrolling area in the status bar. Compatible with podcasting RSS which can be downloaded directly.\nIt\'s also a good Google email notifier. \n\nThe different features of this extension are\n    * RSS feed including RSS Google email notifier (with <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/f7d05bd4a40779e3460a574c6f9fbe996cc2ba9f69a359084cd99e7985ff8593/https%3A//mail.google.com/mail/feed/atom%29">https://mail.google.com/mail/feed/atom)</a>\n    * ATOM feed\n    * NNTP feed\n    * Parsed HTML feed (in fact any text document on internet: RDF, txt, HTML...). Extraction with regular expression\n    * Pre-defined blog search feed (technorati, blogger, ,...)\n    * Support for SSL feed (HTTPS)\n    * Customized refresh time per feed\n    * Automatic or manual refresh\n    * Customized number of headlines to display per feed\n    * Customized number of character to display per feed (status bar is a limited area...)\n    * Customized favicon per feed or group\n    * Customized filter per feed : filter on title, subject, headline number, published date, received date, ...\n    * Enable/Disable filter\n    * Group of feeds\n    * Customized filter per group : filter for the group or combination with feed\'s filter and group\n    * Full associated HTML article in a simple clic on the headline\n    * Customized style sheet for headlines : font family, font size, background color, foreground color\n    * Display headlines in the status bar or in a separate bar (top or bottom)\n    * Manual resize of the status bar area\n    * Automatic size adjustment with the window width\n    * Skip headline\n    * Scrolling feeds in the headline area\n    * Manual scrolling with the mouse wheel\n    * Right to left or left to right scrolling direction\n    * Customized scrolling speed\n    * Fade in/out headlines\n    * All headlines in the main menu as a submenu\n    * Automatic cycling between feed or group or within feed of a group\n    * Skip empty feed in cycling mode\n    * Popup when new headlines\n    * Customized icon bar beside the headline bar\n    * Mark all headlines as read\n    * View all headlines at once\n    * Flashing icon when refreshing\n    * Read article in tooltip, a new tab or a new window\n    * Tooltip on headline to see the full title, begin of article or full article without opening a new tab\n    * Tooltip in HTML mode for rich description\n    * Tooltip that supports multimedia in ENCLOSURE tag : images are displayed beside the description, and audio and video files are played (podcasting, try feed <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/97d86efc2fab7b5e3ede6a0d758d1db84dc0aa297fc716dc5691b1d0878f7f99/http%3A//inforss.mozdev.org/inforss.xml%29">http://inforss.mozdev.org/inforss.xml)</a> with the firefox embedded multimedia plugin\n    * Tooltip on main icon to display the number of hedline / unread headline\n    * Option to play/mute podcast\n    * Display icon near headline in case of enclosure tag\n    * Persistence of viewed and banned headline even after the session\n    * Remote synchronization with FTP or WebDav serverrn    * OPML import and export from a local file or a distant ressource (on internet)\n    * Export the repository in the bookmark hierarchy\n    * Display the repository on screen\n    * Display the RSS file in the browser by dragging the feed in the menu on the browser\n    * Detect RSS feed in the current page and add an item in the menu\n    * Contextual menu in Firefox to add a feed in the extension repository\n    * Add any URL in the clipboard to the menu to simply add it to the repository\n    * Detete a feed in the menu with drag and drop on the trash bin\n    * Add a feed in a group with drag and drop on the group icon in the menu\n    * Link to the main web page in one click\n    * Customized FF add feed menu (orange radar icon) to add feed in infoRSS\n    * Global activity switch\n    * Activity switch at the feed/group level\n    * Collapse headline bar if no headline\n    * Thumbnail image of the main URL in the option dialog\n    * Quick filter icon to filter in one click all displayed headlines\n    * Auto or manual decoding in the HTML feed' },

Please don\'t blame me, this was beyond my control and as you move to Firefox 57+ my add-on will become unusable :-(\n\nToggle Proxy enables you to toggle between two proxies by left-clicking on the icon in the status-bar (or via the shortcut key (\'alt + x\' version 1.3)) or the toolbar icon (added in version 1.7 for Firefox), useful if you use different proxy settings at work and home. (e.g. auto=home, manual=university).   description:
   { 'en-US':
      'Sometimes messages with the type "multipart/alternative" can have multiple bodies with same Content-Type, like "text/plain". However Thunderbird automatically chooses the last one and ignores others, so we cannot read other part bodes even if the last one is broken.\n\nThis addon automatically detects such conflicting bodies and converts secondary part to an attachment.',
     ja:
      '"multipart/alternative"のメールにおいて、複数の本文パートが"text/plain"のような同じContent-Typeを持っている場合、Thunderbirdはそれらの中から最後の物を表示してそれ以外の本文パートを無視します。そのため、最後の本文パートが壊れている場合であっても、他の正常な本文パートは読めないという状態になってしまいます。\n\nこのアドオンは、そのような競合する本文パートを持つメールを自動検出して、2番目以降の競合する本文を添付ファイルに変換します。' },
  developer_comments: null,

Extension 702004 
Compatibility UD
{ id: 702004,
  authors:
   [ { id: 12295599,
       name: 'Silver',

        'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/user/joeyranieri/',
       username: 'joeyranieri' } ],
  average_daily_users: 25,
  categories: { firefox: [ 'alerts-updates', 'social-communication' ] },
  contributions_url: null,
  current_version:
   { id: 1887234,
     compatibility:
      { thunderbird: [Object],
        android: [Object],
        seamonkey: [Object],
        firefox: [Object] },
     edit_url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/developers/addon/remindmebot-reddit/versions/1887234',
     files: [ [Object] ],
     is_strict_compatibility_enabled: false,
     reviewed: null,
     url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/remindmebot-reddit/versions/1.0.9',
     version: '1.0.9' },
  default_locale: 'en-US',
  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'What is the point of RemindMeBot?\n\nRemindMeBot was made as a way to remind the user about a comment or thread for later use. For example, someone on AskReddit posts a list of cool movies to watch. Although you don\'t have time to watch it now, you make a comment to remember to view a movie from the list later. However, you forget about the comment you made because you always find the cool things before sleeping and you have a short attention span to view your previously made comments. Think of RemindMe! as an improved and automatic "saved" for later.' },

   { id: 26603,
     compatibility: { firefox: [Object], thunderbird: [Object] },
     edit_url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/developers/addon/copy-plain-text/versions/26603',
     files: [ [Object] ],
     is_strict_compatibility_enabled: true,
     reviewed: null,
     url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/copy-plain-text/versions/0.3.3',
     version: '0.3.3' },
  default_locale: 'en-US',
  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'Copies text without formatting\n\nHave you ever copied something to Thunderbird or Office and been annoyed that the text formatting (bold, font size, etc) came with it? As of version 2.0.1, Adblock Plus now, by default, deliberately prevents some advertisements from being blocked. This “feature” can be disabled but is turned on by default.  This fork provides the exact same features as Adblock plus, with this unpopular, unwanted "feature" turned off by default.\n\nThe <em>only</em> differences from the default Adblock Plugin are (1) Disabling of "acceptable" advertisements by default and (2) Re-branding so there are no trademark conflicts and it is clear whether Trueblock Plus vs Adblock Plus is installed.\n\nVersion numbers track release numbers of Adblock Plus.\n\nSource Code is released under the MPL, as with Adblock Plus. I just want somewhere to direct friends and family to get a piece of software that blocks ads with minimal configuration.  That\'s it.   current_version:
   { id: 1881276,
     compatibility: { thunderbird: [Object], firefox: [Object] },
     edit_url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/developers/addon/xulmigemo/versions/1881276',
     files: [ [Object] ],
     is_strict_compatibility_enabled: true,
     reviewed: null,

      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/xulmigemo/versions/0.14.9',
     version: '0.14.9' },
  default_locale: 'en-US',
  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'This provides a feature to find Japanese terms in roman-letter spelling. For example, if you input "kanji", Firefox finds any terms of the sound, like "感じ", "幹事" and "漢字". Demonstration video:\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/24454140f2ee14784d4bec434a0a15cc3e4ad1684674f2bf0b90231603549ced/http%3A//piro.sakura.ne.jp/xul/_video/xulmigemo.html.en">http://piro.sakura.ne.jp/xul/_video/xulmigemo.html.en</a>\n\nAdditionally, you can find modified latin letters with their simple versions. For example, "Frédéric" can be found by the input "frederic".\n\nOr, if you want and you switch the find mode, you can do regular expression search for web contents.\n\nXUL/Migemo is available on:\n\n    * Find in this page (FIrefox)\n    * Smart Location Bar (Firefox)\n    * Search boxes of History and Bookmarks (Firefox)\n    * Find in this message (Thunderbird)\n    * Quick Find feature in the thread pane (Thunderbird)\n\nThis project is inspired from "Migemo" project ( <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/cda487cc07b7c643ca024ef0d56900b0d1ca3f19fbf32acfb093727c6e8ad6d2/http%3A//0xcc.net/migemo/">http://0xcc.net/migemo/</a> ), which provides same feature for Emacs and other applications.',
     ja:
      'Firefoxにおける日本語でのページ内検索生活を快適かつ高速にする拡張機能です。いちいち漢字に変換しなくても、ローマ字で「kanzi」と入力するだけでそのまま「感じ」とか「幹事」とか「漢字」とかを検索できるようになります。いまいちピンとこない方は、実際に動いてる様子の動画をご覧下さい。\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/b8701c8b48113841bd3017f7bcb585012719fb8646d0d1132ad74d95ce43c4c3/http%3A//piro.sakura.ne.jp/xul/_video/xulmigemo.html">http://piro.sakura.ne.jp/xul/_video/xulmigemo.html</a>\n\nラテン文字の発音記号などを無視する機能もあります。例えば「frederic」で「Frédéric」がヒットするようになります。\n検索モードを切り替えることで、任意の正規表現でページ内検索を実行することもできます。\n\nXUL/Migemoが利用できる場面は以下の通りです。\n\n    * ページ内検索（Firefox）\n    * スマートロケーションバー（Firefox）\n    * 履歴とブックマークの検索ボックス（Firefox）\n    * メッセージ内検索（Thunderbird）\n    * スレッドペインでのクイック検索（Thunderbird）\n\nこのプロジェクトは、Emacsなどのアプリケーションで同様の機能を提供する「Migemo」プロジェクト（ <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/cda487cc07b7c643ca024ef0d56900b0d1ca3f19fbf32acfb093727c6e8ad6d2/http%3A//0xcc.net/migemo/">http://0xcc.net/migemo/</a> ）にインスパイアされて誕生しました。' },
  developer_comments:
   { 'en-US':
      '* For other languages...\n\nI NEED HELP BY CJK DEVELOPERS. To implement Chinese and Korean engines, I want help. This will help CJK users powerfully because we need to use IMEs to input find terms in our languages. This possibly make IMEs needless to find terms in webpages.\n\nThis extension is designed to use custom engines for multiple languages. If you implement new engines, XUL/Migemo can provide advanced - dictionary-assisted and rapid - infremental search for other languages. But now, only two engines -Japanese and English- are available because I\'m Japanese. If you\'ve developed a new engine for another language, please contact me.\n\nDocuments for developers:\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/255ebbc0d364d86614c733fc9990755ad735d743a5f8a2835501a32e9f887798/http%3A//piro.sakura.ne.jp/xul/_xulmigemo.html.en%23api-engine">http://piro.sakura.ne.jp/xul/_xulmigemo.html.en#api-engine</a>',
     ja:
      '* 機能ごとに別々のアドオンにしない理由\n\nFirefoxのページ内検索の仕組みは、Firefox 1.0の頃のタブブラウズ機能のAPIのように、アドオン開発者にとっては非常に扱い辛い物となっています。ユーザの操作に応じたイベントも発行されませんし、検索ツールバーの状態の変化も通知されません。なので、このアドオンでは検索周りの処理の大部分を上書きして再実装しています。仮にこのアドオンを機能ごとに分割したとしても、それぞれのアドオンは90％くらいまでは同じ物と言っていい状態になるでしょう。\n\n* 朗報\n\nFirefox 3.6以降では、「現在のスクロール位置から検索を開始する」処理が高速になりました。また、Firefox 4.0では一番のボトルネックが解消されるので、Firefox本来のページ内検索とほとんど変わらないスピードが出るようになります。今すぐ試してみたいという人は、XUL/Migemo 0.13.3以降をMinefield 4.0betaにインストールしてみて下さい。\n\n* 他の言語用のエンジンについて\n\nこの拡張機能は、日本語以外のエンジンを組み込むこともできるように設計されています。適切な変換エンジンを実装することで、中国語や韓国語など他の言語でも、辞書と変換エンジンに支援された高速なページ内検索を利用できます。\n\nしかしながら、作者は日本人なので、現段階では日本語用エンジンと英語用エンジンしか実装していません。もし他の言語用のエンジンと辞書を開発された場合は、作者までご連絡下さい。\n\nエンジン開発のための資料：\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/da0569d5227f2313998e50f1a475422fb903e4e994dd8fce869675cd47b669cb/http%3A//piro.sakura.ne.jp/xul/_xulmigemo.html%23api-engine">http://piro.sakura.ne.jp/xul/_xulmigemo.html#api-engine</a>' },

{ id: 13509,
  authors:
   [ { id: 4777175,
       name: 'Julian Fitzell',
       url:
        'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/user/julian-fitzell/',

   { thunderbird: [ 'privacy-and-security' ],
     seamonkey: [ 'privacy-and-security' ],
     firefox: [ 'privacy-security' ] },
  contributions_url: '',
  current_version:
   { id: 1950268,
     compatibility:
      { thunderbird: [Object], seamonkey: [Object], firefox: [Object] },
     edit_url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/developers/addon/keychain-services-integration/versions/1950268',
     files: [ [Object] ],
     is_strict_compatibility_enabled: true,
     reviewed: null,
     url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/keychain-services-integration/versions/1.1.10',
     version: '1.1.10' },
  default_locale: 'en-US',
  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'Apple Keychain Services integration for Mozilla Gecko Toolkit\n\nStore your Firefox website usernames and passwords in Apple\'s Keychain Services, just like Safari and other browsers do on OS X. This allows you to use the same stored logins in any browser that uses the Keychain. It also allows you to take advantage of the security features of Keychain Services such as auto-locking when the screensaver is activated.\n\n<b>Note regarding support for Firefox 57+:</b>\n<blockquote>Unfortunately Mozilla is deprecating the interfaces needed to make this extension work and will be disabling them in Firefox 57. They will need to implement new APIs in order to keep this working in 57+ and it\'s not clear when or if this will happen. More details in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/85dd4b5005dace4ab62e7c6546aa54ebf22a7ae0ffcad2cfd9d2ab0e77340961/https%3A//github.com/jfitzell/mozilla-keychain/issues/88">the github issue</a>. Feel free to add your voice to the relevant Bugzilla tickets:<ul><li><a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/93d8efb5c290ce2036f9cc33a7e310c1f4318a644cc4dfdb9d6771c4213315e5/https%3A//bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi%3Fid=106400">[RFE] Pwmgr should support OS X Keychain</a></li><li><a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/a51340060cf925ec0f1d56b67a1b1631e14fa1ddba8c94388f87b25d1637d428/https%3A//bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi%3Fid=1344788">Implement login storage API</a></li></ul></blockquote>\nOnce installed, Firefox\'s password manager will continue to operate as normal, but passwords should be stored and read from the OS X Keychain instead of from Firefox\'s own database. You should normally be prompted once to migrate passwords from Firefox into the Keychain, but there is little other evidence within Firefox that the extension is running. The easiest way to check that the extension has loaded successfully is to open <code>Preferences</code>, click on the <code>Security</code> tab and look for the message <i>“Passwords are being managed by the Keychain Services Integration add-on”</i>. You will also probably see a <code>Manage Passwords...</code> button there that will launch the Keychain app.\n\nIf you encounter problems, turn on logging by typing <code>about:config</code> in the address bar, then searching for <code>signon.debug</code> and setting it to <code>true</code>. Log output can be found by selecting <code>Tools -&gt; Web Developer -&gt; Browser Console</code> from the menu.\n\nAs always, please <i>backup your keychain files before upgrading</i>, just in case.\n\n<b>Note about iCloud:</b> Because of Apple security controls, it does <i>not</i> seem possible to support iCloud storage unless Mozilla chooses to distribute Firefox via the App Store. Appropriate entitlements must also be requested when building the application. Unfortunately, it\'s not clear that either of these is likely to happen soon.' },
  developer_comments:

Firefox Sync is not yet properly supported - these passwords will still be written to your Firefox password storage.\n\nUsers of older versions of Firefox, should try one of the older versions of this extension which is listed as compatible with their version.\n\n<b>Note: Recent changes to Mozilla Nightly 24.0a1 (ca. 2013-06-20) have broken this extension when "Always use private browsing mode" or "Never remember history" is enabled in Privacy preferences, or when signon.autofilForms is set to false.    { 'en-US':
      'This add-on deactivates new plugins after installation. By installing new software, you may unintentionally install a new plugin. If that occurs and if the preference \'plugin.default.state\' is set to 2 (preference accessible through about:config), Firefox will activate that plugin. As a result, you may experience unnecessary security risks and possibly decreased performance. This extension prevents both potential consequences by deactivating the new plugin after it has been installed. Additionally, it notifies you about the deactivation.\n\nNote: New Plugin Disabler probably does not deactivate the OpenH264 Video Codec plugin included since Firefox 33.' },

  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'Sets proxy settings from environment variables. This is mostly useful for Unix/Linux machines, where the proxy settings are set by environment variables like http_proxy, https_proxy etc. (Konqueror has a similar feature "Use preset proxy environment variables"). This makes it easier for administrators to control the proxy settings for several applications (gaim, konqueror, firefox, thunderbird etc.).\n\nATTENTION: Since Firefox 3.5 this add-on is no longer needed on Unix/Linux machines (see Bug 66057 <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/9176da0eeeb567387a57c897a5cc8bf590b9c3e6f789aa068ade2dcc8a50a8ab/https%3A//bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi%3Fid=66057%29">https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=66057)</a>. Just set your proxy settings to "Use System Settings" and you\'re set.\n\nThe default environment variables used are\nhttp_proxy\nhttps_proxy\nftp_proxy\nno_proxy\nSOCKS_SERVER\nSOCKS_VERSION\nauto_proxy\n\nThese defaults can be changed in the preferences of this extension. If any of the environment variables are found, they are set in the proxy settings and used, if not found, a direct internet connection is used.' },

You\'re smart enough to know that any place that tells you to click on a spot on the screen and type in a word is trying to trick you. You know all the tricks.\n\nSo why should you have to wait to install? Well, you don\'t. Firefox has a built in way of removing the delay. But some of you prefer to have an addon to do all the work for you rather than mess around in about:config. This addon is for you.\n\nNow, just in case you don\'t know all about the risks, please read about it <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/12ac669a59369cc9f85f6a4e1732657bb08ed0645b6f82934e46c926ab1ab58e/http%3A//www.squarefree.com/2004/07/01/race-conditions-in-security-dialogs/%22">from the guy who discovered the problem</a>.\n\n<b>Known Issues</b>\n<li>Firefox is supposed to completely overhaul the addon install system, which should make this addon redundant. This is now available in Firefox 40. However, the Greasemonkey addition is still useful--for now.</li><li>Pressing and holding down alt and typing a word that has an a in it, plus hitting enter, can wind up installing an addon from an unwanted site.   description:
   { 'en-US':
      'When composing a message or editing a web page, you may not want to add alt text for an inserted image. This extension changes the default for new images to add an empty alt text attribute. This corresponds to the "Don\'t insert alternate text" radiobutton selection.\n\nAdditionally the image properties dialog has a bug whereby it fails to realise that you have previously specified no alt text for an existing image. This means that it will nag you to set the alt text of an image, when you really meant to change one of its other properties. This extension works around the problem because it prevents the dialog from defaulting to alt text.\n\nThunderbird 6 has a workaround for this bug in that the alt text will default to the same state as the last image that you edited. Future releases of Thunderbird and SeaMonkey will contain a fix for this bug.' },

  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'I\'m personally tired of those bloated add-ons which serves no purpose other than providing just a bookmark-style button on the add-ons toolbar. I think the least to say is that these just causes an unnecessary Firefox startup overload if you have a few of them.\n\nSo, this restartless and lightweight add-on (4KB code, 8KB package) should make things nicer for those of you who like to use them.\n\nThis add-on provides a preferences window where you can define a URL, Image, and Toolbar ID - being the two later optional. If no image is specified the website\'s favicon will be used instead.\n\n<b>➜ FAQ ✓</b>\n\nQ: What is supposed to be in "ToolBar ID"?\n\nA: Some string representing a DOM Node ID, such as nav-bar (default), PersonalToolbar, TabsToolbar, or addon-bar\n\n\nQ: Can i use icons on my hard-disk for the button\'s image?\n\nA: Yes, you just have to specify them as local/file URLs (ie, file:///...), you can drag&amp;drop any image within a Firefox window/tab to quickly get such a url.\n\n\nQ: Reinstalled the add-on and the buttons are missing, even though they show up on the options.\n\nA: Most likely they are gone at the <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/ba9d0bb797d5d3371835f52e15d78ca2c9ac7d1e819eb2f8b1669256f1fe583d/https%3A//support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/customize-firefox-controls-buttons-and-toolbars%23w_how-do-i-customize-or-rearrange-toolbar-items">Customize Panel</a>\n\n\nQ: My button isn\'t being created!\n\nA: Probably you didn\'t specified a proper URL (ie, something which contains "://")\n\n\nQ: Couldn\'t make it work.  all I got was a blank icon.\n\nA: Either you didn\'t provided an image and the site does not have a proper favicon, or the image you\'ve provided isn\'t valid - try to specify a[nother] image.' },

  average_daily_users: 2,
  categories: { firefox: [ 'photos-music-videos', 'privacy-security' ] },
  contributions_url: null,
  current_version:
   { id: 1607134,
     compatibility: { thunderbird: [Object], firefox: [Object] },
     edit_url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/developers/addon/simple-steganography/versions/1607134',
     files: [ [Object] ],
     is_strict_compatibility_enabled: true,
     reviewed: null,
     url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/simple-steganography/versions/0.1.5.4.1-signed.1-signed',
     version: '0.1.5.4.1-signed.1-signed' },
  default_locale: 'de',
  description:
   { de:
      'This is an experiment by <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/2025a35ed2568245ceea380c8b549e60d23d156e11d6912608e5bdf0d3d1cc1c/http%3A//www.leinelab.org" title="LeineLab Hanover">LeineLab</a> about how to make steganography - in the sense of covered communication, not watermarking - easy enough for common users. There are many great algorithms and programs out there, but most of them are far too complicated for daily use. The "Simple Steganography" plugin tries to combine hiding information with actual usability.\n\n<b>Pictures in Firefox</b>\n\nTo hide a text message in a picture:\nRight-click any image on a page and choose "Embed stego message in selected image/text" - you will be prompted to (1) enter your text and (2) download the finished picture as *.png.\n\nTo extract the text from a given picture:\nRight-click the certain image on the page and choose "Check selected image/text for stego" - the text will be displayed, if it can be extracted with your key.\n\n<b>Pictures in Thunderbird</b>\n\nTo hide a text message in a picture attachment:\nUse the command "Attach PNG image with stego message" from the menu "Stego". You will be prompted to select an image file (which can be any format, not only PNG) and then enter your text. After that, the image will be converted to PNG format and attached to the e-mail.\n\nTo extract the text from a given picture attachment:\nOpen the attachment in Firefox and use the context menu. ;-)\n\n<b>Text Lists in Firefox and/or Thunderbird</b>\n\nTo hide a really very short text message by sorting a list of other texts and/or appending whitespaces to the lines:\nMark the carrier list (i.e.last week\'s shopping list or an index of chapters from Wikipedia), right-click and choose "Embed stego message in selected image/text". You will be prompted to enter your text and choose whether or not to re-sort the lines and/or append whitespace characters to the lines. Then the stego list (sorted and/or containing additional spaces) will pop up in a dialog. You can choose some HTML formatting for your new list or copy it as plain text.\n\nTo extract the text from a given list:\nMark the carrier list, right-click and choose "Check selected image/text for stego" - the message will be displayed, if it can be reconstructed with your key.\n\n<b>Symmetric Passphrase</b>\n\nPlease use the settings dialog to change your personal passphrase. As it is a symmetric key, the person you exchange your messages with must use the same key.\n\nFor images, the key is used to calculated the positions of the pixels that will carry the message. For text lists, the key defines a reference alphabet.\n\nSince version 1.4 you can choose to save your personal key or not. If you prefer to enter the passphrase everytime you process an image/list, make sure the the option "Enter passphrase on demand" is checked.\n\nIf you are tired of typing and want to store your passphrase in the options, then PLEASE READ: Your key is NOT save, in the current version it is stored as plain text in your browser settings. Use this version of the plugin to play around, try everything, report bugs and wishes - but don\'t save any standard passwords!' },

   { de:
      'Known bugs:\nFirefox seems to have a problem handling and saving alpha channels. Simple Steganography works around that by making the pixels is uses opaque.    { 'en-US':
      'Firefox stores its passwords internaly, optionally protected by a master password. KDE has its own password manager called KWallet. KWallet stores every password in the KDE system, and protects access by a master password. With this extension you are able to use KWallet instead of the default Firefox password manager. It allows tighter integration of Firefox inside KDE.\n \nIf you experience SEGFAULTs, it may be due to a bug in Mozilla\'s new JIT compiler. Try disabling it by setting javascript.options.baselinejit.* in about:config to false.',
     es:
      'Firefox almacena sus contraseñas internamente, opcionalmente protegidas por una contraseña maestra. KDE tiene su propio gestor de contraseñas llamado KWallet. KWallet almacena todas las contraseñas en el sistema de KDE, y protege el acceso con una contraseña maestra. Con esta extensión usted es capaz de utilizar KWallet en lugar de la contraseña de administrador por defecto de Firefox. Permitiendo una mayor integración de Firefox dentro de KDE.\n \nSi al instalar este plugin se experimentan SEGFAULTs, puede ser debido a un bug en el nuevo compilador JIT de Mozilla.       'This extension makes hot keys work with Russian and Ukrainian "йцукен" keyboard layouts in Linux and *BSD (needed only for GTK2 builds). Don\'t try it with other languages/layouts, the result will be unpredictable. The problem with hot keys is well known to all Russian Mozilla users, it was reported over 6 years ago (bug #69230) but is fixed only in Firefox 3 beta 2. The extension is a hack, but it solves the problem for previous versions.\n\nSince 1.4 there is also experimental support for Hebrew and Russian/Ukrainian Dvorak layouts. Hebrew should work out-of-the-box (except keys with "Q" and "W"). To activate Dvorak mode go to about:config and specify integer "extensions.rhkbf.layout" preference (create it if it does not exist). The values are: "0" for Cyrillic and Hebrew "йцукен" (default) and "2" for Cyrillic Dvorak.' },

  default_locale: 'en-US',
  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'This extension displays different mouse cursors than the default depending on what part of the scrollbar the cursor is hovering. It is primarily designed for use with thin scrollbars in order to provide better visual feedback.\n\n<b>Note:</b> Changes to scrollbar elements may not take effect until the page/window element to which the scrollbar is attached is reloaded. Some browser chrome elements reload automatically; most page elements do not, therefore they\'ll need to be reloaded manually. (So, while this extension is restartless, you will probably need to reload any already opened pages before you see any change to your cursors.)\n\n<b>Trivia:</b> The name of this extension derives from my Elegant Scrollbars style at <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/079d2a2665417d4517d296655a3ba3e6d81e1f5cc53804cc1a2bb8229113b659/http%3A//userstyles.org">userstyles.org</a>. The style is "elegant" in that it uses no images to define plain, basic scrollbars that are thin and functional using any colors preferred by the user. The code used here for displaying alternate cursors was simply extracted from that style. The cursors are not themselves anything I would call elegant; they\'re just the cursors provided by your platform.' },
  developer_comments: null,

  default_locale: 'en-US',
  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'This extension displays different mouse cursors than the default depending on what part of the scrollbar the cursor is hovering. It is primarily designed for use with thin scrollbars in order to provide better visual feedback.\n\n<b>Note:</b> Changes to scrollbar elements may not take effect until the page/window element to which the scrollbar is attached is reloaded. Some browser chrome elements reload automatically; most page elements do not, therefore they\'ll need to be reloaded manually. (So, while this extension is restartless, you will probably need to reload any already opened pages before you see any change to your cursors.)\n\n<b>Trivia:</b> The name of this extension derives from my Elegant Scrollbars style at <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/079d2a2665417d4517d296655a3ba3e6d81e1f5cc53804cc1a2bb8229113b659/http%3A//userstyles.org">userstyles.org</a>. The style is "elegant" in that it uses no images to define plain, basic scrollbars that are thin and functional using any colors preferred by the user. The code used here for displaying alternate cursors was simply extracted from that style. The cursors are not themselves anything I would call elegant; they\'re just the cursors provided by your platform.' },

   { 'en-US':
      'Resizes and positions the Firefox window according to your settings.' },
  developer_comments:
   { 'en-US':
      'Custom Geometry adds a button to the Firefox status bar that will resize the Firefox window to your specifications. Many other extensions will resize the window, but only to preset dimensions, such as 1024x768 or 800x600. Custom Geometry will set the window to an arbitrary size.\n\nI needed this functionality because I prefer my browser window to be in a particular location and size on my screen. Since I\'m using Microsoft Windows XP, the prospect of the browser window staying where I want it is dim. A video game, misclick, or even just a popup window (usatoday.com anyone?) will resize the window. Now, a single click gets it back into place.\n\nIf you only want this functionality to work with a particular site (for instance, your home page), then set the "Window Title" property to the title of that site or window.  Using "Default" means that it works for all windows and sites.\n\nInstructions:\n\n1.  Open the CustomGeometry-1.0.0.xpi file in Firefox 2.0.\n2. Choose to install the extension.\n3. Restart Firefox when instructed to do so.\n4. Open the addons window by clicking "Tools," then "Add-ons."\n5. Select "Custom Geometry" from the list.\n6. Click the "Options" button.\n7. Set the window geometry options that you prefer.\n8. Hit "OK" to save your preferences.\n9. Click the new icon on the lower right right side of the status bar to apply these settings at any time.\n' },

{ id: 4471,
  authors:
   [ { id: 62305,
       name: 'Subrata Mazumdar',

        'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/user/subrataxmazumdar/',

   { firefox: [ 'privacy-security', 'web-development' ],

     thunderbird: [ 'privacy-and-security' ] },
  contributions_url: null,
  current_version:
   { id: 1484177,
     compatibility:
      { firefox: [Object], seamonkey: [Object], thunderbird: [Object] },
     edit_url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/developers/addon/key-manager/versions/1484177',
     files: [ [Object] ],
     is_strict_compatibility_enabled: true,
     reviewed: null,
     url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/key-manager/versions/0.1.240.20130821',
     version: '0.1.240.20130821' },
  default_locale: 'en-US',
  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'KeyManager is a client side PKI tool for key generation, certificate enrollment,  and identity and authority delegation.   \nCurrently, Mozilla Personal Security Manager (PSM) allows import and export of keys but does not provide GUI for local key generation. Our KeyManager tool extends the Certificate Manager wizard in Mozilla PSM and adds the capability for key generation and SCEP based certificate enrollment.  Our extension enables Mozilla PSM to act as a key management tool. In addition, the tool supports signing of proxy certificates for credential delegation and provides XUL based GUI for signing of XPI files as well as update manifest. \n\n\nThe KeyManager tool has following features : \n  - Generation of keys and <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/8cfe5aeda2ab6112ba31daa7659f25e7e1022ad3a8fb8a64957979ef01fc6c44/http%3A//www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3280.txt">X.509</a> based self-signed certificate\n  - Generation of <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/ac5132a38357325d1a2072d34b29e5e7ae96e47efed5bc7fda9ff190519af8d7/http%3A//tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2986">PKCS#10 based Certificate Signing Requests</a> (CSR)\n  - <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/7e6765741879eb1edb42dd647c73ebc3d3144055188ca3e4211172c1d11df984/http%3A//tools.ietf.org/html/draft-nourse-scep-20">SCEP</a> based Certificate enrollment - it enables Firefox to acts as SCEP client. The SCEP client can be invoked from other extensions and XPCOM based components. \n   \n  - XPI Signing (for Mozilla add-ons) and signing of archive files - provides an XUL based GUI for command-line <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/074168546d19796654a9e5610bfd484469f09df2db9c9b13073e029f7eaabf56/http%3A//docs.sun.com/source/816-5531-10/app_sign.htm">\'signtool\' </a> in Mozilla NSS \n  - <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/d91b40b3001d347005520cfd80337e880440e746c693604e9556451d64fc4baa/https%3A//developer.mozilla.org/en/extension_versioning%2C_update_and_compatibility%23Signing_Update_Manifests">Signing of update manifest</a> using keys associated with certificate in the browser\'s certificate DB. You can use this tool as alternative to Mozilla\'s <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/a27d7c7cdb075a830488cf98b24e98f90c470ab07788a49c350f1a05bcf77c26/https%3A//developer.mozilla.org/en/McCoy">McCoy</a> tool. \n  - Signing of Proxy Certificates (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/91fad034495611076bf922640666e677bcfcfb91bb4035a3ae1c21a0b328d88a/http%3A//www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3820.txt">RFC 3820</a>) and other users\' certificates \n  - Signing and verification of Attribute certificates (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/b899a79d0491bdea8f0b4fae68e84f4aac6ce29b40f662a8c72c659589b1aa4a/http%3A//www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3281.txt">RFC3281</a>) \n  - Exporting of keys and certificate in the following formats: PKCS#7, PKCS#8, PKCS#10, PKCS#12,  <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/c6655c1a22750f1c9eaaae8cccde247f9829d3376dba2bc4cd73d7b668032c8b/http%3A//www.openssl.org/">OpenSSL</a>, and <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/82dcf55f5159e14f560b5e27ea1742c1d972ad40c166e2cc11a3da211d55243f/http%3A//tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4251">SSH-2</a>\n   - Backup and Synchronization of keys and certificates for OpenSSL based applications: cURL, Globus toolkit, etc as well as other Mozilla-NSS based soft-tokens\n   - Managing keys and sign certificates in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/5f3a10a0b3d1224944e22ab853c77a7f0c3d8adb11b6aa87340cd1dd7bfc1020/http%3A//download.oracle.com/docs/cd/E17476_01/javase/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/solaris/keytool.html">Java Keystores </a>\n\nFor more info: \n  - Key Manager Tool: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/cc9dd0ad24f603b806cb19397007459eb5c808b386f2b5fd947f9e9ea57c0b2b/http%3A//pubs.research.avayalabs.com/pdfs/ALR-2006-044.pdf">http://pubs.research.avayalabs.com/pdfs/ALR-2006-044.pdf</a> \n\n  - Use case on on-line proxy certificate signing and credential delegation for Globus Grid based portal: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/528e8efa01d8f2fc397b22bd1b9ca05f2f8e04e66c3fefe0f0a6adb79a7c6dc1/http%3A//pubs.research.avayalabs.com/pdfs/ALR-2007-023.pdf">http://pubs.research.avayalabs.com/pdfs/ALR-2007-023.pdf</a>' },
  developer_comments:
   { 'en-US':
      'This tool is intended for software developers working in the area of PKI based security. \n\nFF  version of this add-on is successfully tested on following x86 based OSes: GNU/Linux (Fedora8(x86), Fedora12(x86_64)), Windows ( XP-SP3), Mac OSX (Snow Leopard).  \n\nNote: For Ubuntu, this add-on works only with the Firefox downloaded from Mozilla site. This add-on may not work with Firefox that comes with Ubuntu distribution.\n\nSCEP client tool is tested with <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/458ba04afc1a37b588aa55ea12957e95e5982f3e390f78718fbaec7f144da9de/http%3A//www.openca.org/projects/openca/">OpenCA</a>, <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/6f4379b7debc7a833aa409057a9b57ca00b1a2b1635cebdea7311e6ef41fedb7/http%3A//www.ejbca.org/">EJBCA</a> and <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/154d18289de88fda581d3792f0376e4474f0621a6ee24d6cf143d676a1433ba2/http%3A//technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc753784%2528WS.10%2529.aspx">MS-SCEP</a>.\n\nYou can think of this tool as XUL based GUI for following <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/3e329a949bbae67f9739d268f59581fa36720789956deec461247aecac9f6ece/http%3A//www.mozilla.org/projects/security/pki/nss/tools/">NSS command line tools</a>:  <code>certutil, pk12util, signtool,</code> and <code>crlutil</code>. If you are not really keen on learning these excellent Mozilla-NSS command line tools, you  can use this extension to do the same tasks.  This extension also borrows from the web-interface for <code>certcgi</code> tool to provide XUL forms for fine grain control on specifying various certificate extensions. \n\nYou can also generate keys and import certificates for hardware tokens (e.g. Smart card), if the smart card and the associated PKCS#11 driver supports key generation.  \n\nFor signing of XPI files for Firefox add-ons  or creating digitally-signed jar archives containing files and/or code, you must have a code signing certificate. For details follow the link for <code>signtool</code> in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/3e329a949bbae67f9739d268f59581fa36720789956deec461247aecac9f6ece/http%3A//www.mozilla.org/projects/security/pki/nss/tools/">NSS tools  page</a>.\n\nInstallation Instructions:\n  Please install the "KeyManager" extension using a different profile than your default Firefox profile until you are familiar and comfortable with various features of the tools. In order to create new profile, \n    - On Windows, run <code>"C:\\Program Files\\Mozilla Firefox\\firefox.exe" /p </code>\n    - On Linux, run <code>firefox -ProfileManager  </code>\n\nFor more info on architecture and  implementation, please review the following document: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/cc9dd0ad24f603b806cb19397007459eb5c808b386f2b5fd947f9e9ea57c0b2b/http%3A//pubs.research.avayalabs.com/pdfs/ALR-2006-044.pdf">http://pubs.research.avayalabs.com/pdfs/ALR-2006-044.pdf</a>' },

Extension 4522 
Compatibility UD
{ id: 4522,
  authors:
   [ { id: 62305,
       name: 'Subrata Mazumdar',
       url:
        'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/user/subrataxmazumdar/',
       username: 'subrataxmazumdar' } ],
  average_daily_users: 0,
  categories:
   { thunderbird: [ 'privacy-and-security' ],
     seamonkey: [ 'privacy-and-security', 'web-and-developer-tools' ],
     firefox: [ 'privacy-security', 'web-development' ] },
  contributions_url: null,
  current_version:
   { id: 1484149,
     compatibility:
      { thunderbird: [Object], seamonkey: [Object], firefox: [Object] },
     edit_url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/developers/addon/xml-digital-signature-tool/versions/1484149',
     files: [ [Object], [Object], [Object] ],
     is_strict_compatibility_enabled: true,
     reviewed: null,
     url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/xml-digital-signature-tool/versions/0.1.240.20130821',
     version: '0.1.240.20130821' },
  default_locale: 'en-US',
  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'XML Digital Signature Tool is a Firefox add-on for processing Digital Signature in XML documents (follows the <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/f784b95dcf5eea0b52114187ad89a28e23c0ea63d3ef70870228bc01a3a537d4/http%3A//www.w3.org/Signature/">W3C specification for XML-Signature Syntax and Processing </a> ).\n\nThe XML digital signature tool is built on top of <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/e9fc2c04485f5ab614b8eba17d45910c468a6ea64381bf8bc5d33f8e28bb183c/http%3A//santuario.apache.org/">Apache XML Security for C++ library</a> , called XSEC. No changes were made to XSEC source code. We just compiled the source with NSS option to provide cryptographic functionality using browser\'s certificate database. The re-compiled XSEC library is packaged with the XPI file for this add-on.\n\nThis tool provides an XPCOM-IDL based  wrapper around  C++ based Apache XML security library. Our XPCOM-IDL based API allows any Firefox based extension to access XSEC library using JavaScript and C++. This tool also provides XUL based GUI for specifying various parameters for signing XML files and verifying signed XML files.\n\nIn addition, the tool provides following features: \n  - encryption and decryption of XML documents (follows the W3C spec for <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/f11b2f8b558c4f311cf421a2cd8bbb2f9abe2295734652a27d4f8bfc38b89fe5/http%3A//www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/">XML Encryption Syntax and Processing</a>)\n  - ability to generate Self-Issued <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/e6557d762a826fe550dc3904aed5a3b1d7da8e5fc70172a762d3ebd889760e09/http%3A//saml.xml.org/">SAML</a> Token (both <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/9db391ebe63f6b76040551d635d14119bdbe709ddd51ed57b0f72a5c23f9f2b4/http%3A//www.oasis-open.org/specs/%23samlv1.1">v1.1</a><a> and </a><a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/96a368d631d98318d5700e575d5dc0b230bb6365289171bf36d0aedcd0b8536f/http%3A//www.oasis-open.org/specs/%23samlv2.0">v2.0</a>) using the RSA/DSA keys  in the browser\'s certificate DB.  The SAML Token generation is implemented using our XPCOM based component for signing and encryption of XML documents.      \n  - XPCOM based API for UUID generation. The XPCOM implementation reuses the UUID generation       source code in the <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/5fdecd6d137a523f22aa2932f1b3baa086cf886726ebab9bd50936e0e4f93619/http%3A//www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122.txt">RFC4122</a>. We have adapted the  UUID generation code code in RFC4122 for Mozilla NSS based digest and added string based UUID API.   \n  - Signing of HTML document and verification of signed HTML pages - follows <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/2198990231fa6360777e3cc751f32839e16af7035cce746293e4f9da39522d09/http%3A//www.w3.org/2007/11/h6n/">W3C HTML Signing Profile</a>\n \nFor more information: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/b84712367d2db60a7de9c7d1dd74bbba66a278178ce1bad09450f9af82c8c053/http%3A//pubs.research.avayalabs.com/pdfs/ALR-2007-013.pdf">http://pubs.research.avayalabs.com/pdfs/ALR-2007-013.pdf</a>\n\n<b>Note</b>: Please download and install Apache XML libraries before installing this add-on. See the "Advanced Details" section for installation instruction for Apache XERCES C++ libraries. \n\nNote: This tool works only on x86-based Windows (32-bit only), Mac OSX, and Linux (64-bit only) OSes. <b>This version does not support 32-bit Linux anymore.</b>' },
  developer_comments:
   { 'en-US':
      'My goal is to provide XPCOM based API for XML Digital Signature processing  using Mozilla NSS Crypto API. The Java based API for XMLDSIG is  not easy to use with browser for selection of certificates from browser\'s certificate DB. \n\nI am using Apache XML Security C++ libraries because it supports Mozilla NSS Crypto API and it has XML canonicalization  API that complies with W3 spec.  \n \nThis tool automatically selects a list of user certificates (from the browser\'s certificate DB based on ObjectSigner key usage criteria) which can be used to sign XML documents and present them as a menu list. The XML file to be signed is picked using the file browser. The signature parameters are chosen from a set of form fields. \n&lt;p&gt;\n \n<b>System Requirements</b>:\n\nThe <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/67ea279e90e0bbe727309bf5eca8d1de621a454088c2a0d97ef34d6e3c42ef79/http%3A//santuario.apache.org/download.html">Apache XML Security for C++</a>  library uses the Apache <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/d46b8909ea293364b168ca3c090dd77384d8573a47986f17c130f330143a00a8/http%3A//xml.apache.org/">XML project\'s </a> <a rel="nofollow" href="/">Xerces-C++ XML Parser </a>and Xalan-C XSLT processor. The latter is used for processing XPath and XSLT transforms. This add-on does not support Xalan-based transforms. The XPI file for this add-on includes Mozilla-NSS enabled Apache XML security libraries for C++.   But, this tool does not include the <b>\'required\'</b> DLL or shared library for Xerces-C . You have to download and install Apache XERCES for C++ library before you install this add-on. The path for shared libraries or DLL of XERCES <b>must be</b> in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH (for Unix) or PATH (for windows).\n\nYou have to install and configure the <a rel="nofollow" href="/">Apache XERCES C++</a> libraries before you can use the Add-on. Please follow the instructions below for respective platform.\n\n<b>Download, Install and configure the Apache XML Libraries before installing the add-on :</b>\n\nApache XML Libraries Installation and Configuration Instructions for <b>Firefox 5.0+</b> :\n&lt;/p&gt;<ul>   <li>For x86 Windows (32-bit only)\n   <ul>          <li><b>FF v23 and below : </b>Download and install Apache Xerces-C++ ( <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/bcdd9f2bd4bd177963311e7b829d5c33d2713332bf2470fb13a4f59a17053f86/http%3A//www.apache.org/dist/xerces/c/3/binaries/xerces-c-3.1.1-x86-windows-vc-9.0.zip%29">http://www.apache.org/dist/xerces/c/3/binaries/xerces-c-3.1.1-x86-windows-vc-9.0.zip)</a>\n         </li><li><b>FF v24 and up : </b>Download and install Apache Xerces-C++ ( <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/978a6782258ccaf1d24ead4cd1c5eee7c992329d5e4dc0f62fd0d0a43d83713b/http%3A//www.apache.org/dist/xerces/c/3/binaries/xerces-c-3.1.1-x86-windows-vc-10.0.zip%29">http://www.apache.org/dist/xerces/c/3/binaries/xerces-c-3.1.1-x86-windows-vc-10.0.zip)</a>  \n          </li><li>Extract and Install the downloaded file .\n           </li><li>Add the Xerces-C++ bin directories to your PATH environment variable.  For more info on installation, go to  <a rel="nofollow" href="/">Xerces-C++ XML Parser</a> project page.\n                </li><li>set PATH=&lt;XERCES-INSTALL-DIR&gt;\\bin;%PATH%\n       </li></ul>    </li>    <li>For x86  Linux - 32 bit  (<b>Not supported any more.</b>)\n    \n    </li>    <li>For x86_64  Linux\n       <ul>          <li>Download and install Apache Xerces-C++  ( <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/e9be97a3ac4e53fa99e16a04b2df1ba0c243fdca910cbef9fc56bed44d0cbf0b/http%3A//www.apache.org/dist/xerces/c/3/binaries/xerces-c-3.1.1-x86-linux-gcc-3.4.tar.gz%29">http://www.apache.org/dist/xerces/c/3/binaries/xerces-c-3.1.1-x86-linux-gcc-3.4.tar.gz)</a> for Linux x86_64.\n          </li><li>Extract and Install the downloaded file .\n          </li><li>Add the Xerces-C++ lib directories to your LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable. For more info on installation, go to <a rel="nofollow" href="/">Xerces-C++ XML Parser </a> project page.\n                </li><li>export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=&lt;XERCES-INSTALL-DIR&gt;/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH\n        </li></ul>    </li>    \n    <li>For x86_64 Mac OSX\n       <ul>           <li>             The binary component for Xerces-C++ for Mac OSX x86_64 platform is not available from Apache Xerces-C++ download site. \n           </li><li>            You have to download the source package and build for  Mac OSX x86_64 platform. After you build and install the complied binary from the source, add the  installed Xerces-C++ lib directories to your DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH environment  variable. For more info on installation, go to  <a rel="nofollow" href="/">Xerces-C XML Parser</a> project page.\n             </li>             <li>              export DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=&lt;XERCES-INSTALL-DIR&gt;/lib:$DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH\n             </li>           </ul>    </li></ul>Finally, restart the browser and then install the add-on from this page. \n&lt;p&gt;\n\n<b>Note</b>: \n&lt;/p&gt;<ul>    <li>This add-on may not work with Firefox distributed with some Linux platform. You have to download the Firefox from the Mozilla site. \n    </li><li>This tool is tested only on Fedora Linux (x86_64), Mac OSX 10.7.5  and Windows XP-SP3 OSes. It may or may not work on other Linux x86 OSes. <b>Note: This version does not support 32-bit Linux. </b>\n   </li><li>If the signing does not work, re-install the Add-on - uninstall then install. Do not install over existing Add-on. \n    </li><li>Also, check to make sure that DLLs (shared libraries) from Apache Xerces-C++  are in your PATH (LD_LIBRARY_PATH) environment variable. \n   </li><li>Please make sure that the "ObjectSigner" key-usage is \'true\' for the signing certificate - otherwise the certificate associated with the signing key won\'t be part of the displayed in the list for signing certificates. \n   </li><li>If you need a tool to generate keys/self-signed certs  for signing of XML documents, you can try our KeyManager Add-on for Firefox :  <a rel="nofollow" href="https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/key-manager/">https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/key-manager/</a></li></ul>\nEnabling of HTML Document signing and signature validation :\nHTML document signing tool and HTML signature validation is disabled by default. Use the Preference window to enable it as follows: \n<ul>  <li> "Tools --&gt; Add-on --&gt; Select XML Digital Signature Processing Tool --&gt; Preferences/Options"\n  </li><li>Select the "HTML Signature Tool" tab\n  </li><li>Check the "Enable HTML Digital Signature Tool" to display the menu item under Tools menu\n </li><li>Check the "Enable HTML Digital Signature Validation" if you want to validate the HTML signature embedded in a HTML document as it is being displayed by the browser \n </li><li>Check the "Override proxy restriction" if you want do signature validation in HTML pages that are accessed using a HTTP proxy. If you are behind a firewall, overriding proxy restriction will hang your browser until it times out for no responses. </li></ul>\nIf the HTML signature validation is enabled, then a small icon appears on the status bar of the browser if the page contains HTML signature. This status icon displays the information about the signature and the results of the signature validation.' },
  edit_url:
   'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/developers/addon/xml-digital-signature-tool/edit',
  guid: '{bcb4f322-a177-4ecd-9c80-835d96e1e595}',

Compatibility UD
{ id: 700342,
  authors:
   [ { id: 11066970,
       name: 'Qeole',
       url:
        'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/user/Qeole/',
       username: 'Qeole' } ],
  average_daily_users: 0,
  categories: { thunderbird: [ 'miscellaneous' ] },
  contributions_url: null,
  current_version:
   { id: 1858938,
     compatibility: { thunderbird: [Object] },
     edit_url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/developers/addon/generate-patch-command/versions/1858938',
     files: [ [Object] ],
     is_strict_compatibility_enabled: true,
     reviewed: null,
     url:
      'https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/generate-patch-command/versions/1.1.0',
     version: '1.1.0' },
  default_locale: 'fr',
  description:
   { fr:
      '<strong>Presentation</strong>\n\nYou have to send a lot of patches to mailing list with the <code>git send-email</code> command line utility, but are tired of manually picking email addresses and email IDs to paste them in your command line? This Thuderbird add-on has been made just to address your needs. From a given email in Thuderbird, it generates the whole command line to answer to this email and selects it; all you need to do is to copy/paste this single line into your terminal to send your patch.\n\nOh, well, technically you still have to add the name of the patch you want to send… but the <code>--to=</code> and <code>--cc=</code> and <code>--in-reply-to=</code> should all be handled for you.\n\n<strong>Usage</strong>\n\nOnce installed, go to Thunderbird and select an email, and go to the email pane (the one in which the body of the email is displayed). You have <code>Reply</code> and <code>Reply All</code>/<code>Reply List</code> and <code>Forward</code> and <code>Archive</code>, <code>Junk</code> buttons and so on at the top of the pane, on the header box. The last of those buttons labeled <code>More ⏷</code>. It opens a drop-down menu if you click on it. Do so: there is now a new item entitled Generate patch command. This is it! Click on it, and a pop-up window will show you the generated command line, already selected for you to copy.\n\nNote that the text box is editable, so that you can edit the command before you copy it.\n\n<strong>Disclaimers</strong>\n\n<b>Regarding security</b>\n\nAlways be <strong>extremely careful</strong> with what you copy and paste into your terminal. People have shown <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/aa05f9a243d550fe4951030e86b15b069e414627622838bd77c6ddaf48eadea4/https%3A//thejh.net/misc/website-terminal-copy-paste" title="here is a detailed example">many times</a> that it is possible to hide rogue code. Even if this add-on is on Mozilla\'s official platform, you should remain careful.\n\nAlso, it could be that some input coming from the headers will break the commands. The add-on encloses it with single quotes, and tries to escape single quotes coming from the input, but there might be some subtleties I forgot to deal with. Just be cautious, and check for correctness of the command.\n\n<b>Regarding responsibility</b>\n\nBe cautious before you validate your command line: read and proofread whatever command you enter. The add-on provide the commands as a best effort, but is not error prone. I will not be responsible if you send trash to a public mailing list, or if you send emails to the wrong people. So again: verify that everything looks fine before sending the email.' },

  description:
   { 'en-US':
      'Site was down for some time, but now back up.\n\nCustom Buttons² extension buttons can be written to do various tasks that the user may require. The buttons are coded in JavaScript. Many bookmarklets can easily be converted to buttons.\n\nExtension developers will find this extension quite useful in the development cycle. JavaScript code can be prototyped in a custom button, avoiding the reload chrome step until the code is proven.  Then the code can be moved to the extension\n\nFlock &amp; Thunderbird supported starting with Version 2.0.5.9\n\ncustombuttons custombuttons2\n\nDocumentation:\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/d248292a291978fb03650ac8764dd284efd2160aeb8a5866eaff788fef337f14/http%3A//custombuttons2.com/wiki/documentation">http://custombuttons2.com/wiki/documentation</a>' },
  developer_comments:
   { 'en-US':
      'Custom Buttons² now runs in Firefox thru version 3.2a1pre and Thunderbird thru version 3.0b2pre, the latest Flock, and Sunbird version 1.0pre\n\nTo install an existing button from the Custom Buttons² Forum for instance, you need to merely:\n1. Click on the link for the button\n2. Follow the instructions that appear via the alert prompts.\n3. You can also drag &amp; drop the button link onto the import button.\n\nTo create a new button:\nIn the main-menu, View select the “Add New Button” item.\n1. Fill in the Name field with an appropriate button name. If the image field is left empty, the button image will default to the Custom Button star.\n2. The Code section only executes when the button is clicked.\n3. The Initialization code section executes when the button is saved/applied and each time Firefox starts. Either section may be left empty.\n4. Now, in the main-menu, View &gt;&gt; Toolbars &gt;&gt; Customize... Find the new button and drag &amp; drop it where you want it on a toolbar.\n\nLocales: en-US, de-DE, fr-FR, it-IT, nl-NL, pl-PL, pt-BR, sk-SK, sv-SE, zh-CN\n\n\nGeneral Forum Discussions:\n\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/11f51fa117f9fcbc4e63a62cbb49b269c1a919491c7bdde8c700eb8cd8ce9bb0/http%3A//forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php%3Ft=428688">http://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?t=428688</a>\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/6a3464d4ee7917f2774bacba53b82d6c064680ce8bc5a79ef45a666d7de49102/http%3A//custombuttons2.com/forum/">http://custombuttons2.com/forum/</a>\n\nCurrent &amp; Beta Versions plus Discussions:\n\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/871c93ae7fc41b875e7c9c28ceb2a3dc991de2dedef035079eedec6274dcb8ab/http%3A//custombuttons2.com/">http://custombuttons2.com/</a>\n\nFor additional information and discussions of the Custom Buttons concept you can also see:\n\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/6a3464d4ee7917f2774bacba53b82d6c064680ce8bc5a79ef45a666d7de49102/http%3A//custombuttons2.com/forum/">http://custombuttons2.com/forum/</a>\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/c3b1a824fd08da49509001d61218d8100d7f86f75caed5e1d60b3db376159942/http%3A//forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php%3Ft=428688%232321930">http://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?t=428688#2321930</a>\n<a rel="nofollow" href="https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/2707">https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/2707</a>\n\nThe Custom Buttons² Extension Development Group, is a subset of the Custom Buttons² Forum members at <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/6a3464d4ee7917f2774bacba53b82d6c064680ce8bc5a79ef45a666d7de49102/http%3A//custombuttons2.com/forum/">http://custombuttons2.com/forum/</a>, is committed to improving and maintaining the extension through Firefox 3 and beyond. Versions of the Custom Buttons extension 0.0.1.3 and earlier will not be maintained or extended by our group.\n\nYour comments and discussion points are important to our team and are quite welcome.\n\nPlease submit Bug reports and Feature Requests at <a rel="nofollow" href="https://outgoing.prod.mozaws.net/v1/b1701d54b78e2e14f38a650fbb1acfc8138ddc75dbef19821a68e6d59fc8b399/http%3A//custombuttons2.com/forum/support/extension-support">http://custombuttons2.com/forum/support/extension-support</a>\n\nEnjoy &amp; please leave comments.' },
